title: Cabinet of Singapore
summary: The Cabinet of Singapore forms the executive branch of the Government of Singapore together with the president. It is led by the prime minister who is the head of government. The prime minister is a Member of Parliament (MP) appointed by the president who selects a person that in their view is likely to command the confidence of a majority of the Parliament. The other members of the Cabinet are ministers who are Members of Parliament appointed by the president on the prime minister's advice. Cabinet members are prohibited from holding any office of profit and from actively engaging in any commercial enterprise.
